controller

Class MenuController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MenuController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class MenuController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller for menu sidebar. Controls the bottons, logout and master view
    Author:
    Ron

        void homeClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        When click on Home button. Changes the window title and button design. Shows the relevant screen

        When click on New Request button. Changes the window title and button design. Shows the relevant screen

      • logoutClick

        void logoutClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        When click on Logout button. Shows an alert, and if 'ok' chosen, disconnects user and shows login screen.

      • processesClick

        void processesClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        When click on Processes button. Changes the window title and button design. Shows the relevant screen Only permitted users can see this button

      • reportsClick

        void reportsClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        When click on Reports button. Changes the window title and button design. Shows the relevant screen Only Manager can see this button

      • employeesClick

        void employeesClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        When click on Employees button. Changes the window title and button design. Shows the relevant screen Only Manager can see this button

      • sceneManager

        private void sceneManager(java.lang.String fxmlName,
                          javafx.scene.control.Button button)
        Change the view to the relevant view for the button clicked
        Parameters:
        fxmlName - The name of the fxml file to load.
        button - The button clicked by user.

      • buttonStyle

        private void buttonStyle(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
        Changes the style of button when pressed
        Parameters:
        button - The pressed button

      • logoutUser

        private void logoutUser()
        Called when pressed on Logout. Shows an Alert, if user decided to logout - sends logout request to server, removes user from loggedIn users, and shows login screen if user cancel logout: just shows the same screen before clicked on Logout

      • permissionCheck

        private void permissionCheck(java.lang.String role)
        Shows menu that matches the user role (permission)
        Parameters:
        role - The user's role
